intro: Ptilotus corymbosus, commonly known as the yellow bush morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in sandy or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Ptilotus corymbosus is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
